result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Thomas Steinmetz IV

records.addlTxt: 1:22 PM Defendant Charles Thomas Steinmetz IV appeared by video.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii appeared by video for Charles Thomas Steinmetz IV.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:08 PM Defendant Charles Thomas Steinmetz IV appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Charles Thomas Steinmetz IV.  Attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.O., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 1PM.
